DataElement.preferredName: Prior Vitamin D Supplement Duration Less Than 12 Months Use Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no indicator related to a prior Vitamin D supplement use duration of less than 12 months.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Prior D Vitamin Dietary Supplement Duration Less Than 12 Months Use
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order._Vitamin D. The vitamin that mediates intestinal calcium absorption, bone calcium metabolism, and probably muscle activity. It usually acts as a hormone precursor, requiring 2 stages of metabolism before reaching actual hormonal form. It is isolated from fish liver oils and used in the treatment and prevention of rickets._Oral preparations containing dietary ingredient(s) intended to supplement the diet.  Dietary ingredients include vitamins, minerals, herbs, amino acids, extracts and metabolites._The period of time during which something continues._A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest is smaller than another object in quantity or measure or value or status._A period of time of twelve months._A manner, or usual, or accepted practice of using something.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order.:Vitamin D. The vitamin that mediates intestinal calcium absorption, bone calcium metabolism, and probably muscle activity. It usually acts as a hormone precursor, requiring 2 stages of metabolism before reaching actual hormonal form. It is isolated from fish liver oils and used in the treatment and prevention of rickets.

Concepts.definition: A family of lipo-soluble steroids important to the absorption, metabolism, and function of calcium and phosphorus and the growth and development of bone and tooth enamel. Found naturally in animal tissues, cholecalciferol (vitamin D3) is formed in the skin when ultraviolet light activates cholesterol conversion into vitamin D3. Ultraviolet irradiation of ergosterol (plant vitamin D) forms ergocalciferol (vitamin D2). (NCI04)

Property.preferredName: Dietary Supplement Duration Less Than 12 Months Use
Property.preferredDefinition: Oral preparations containing dietary ingredient(s) intended to supplement the diet.  Dietary ingredients include vitamins, minerals, herbs, amino acids, extracts and metabolites.:The period of time during which something continues.:A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest is smaller than another object in quantity or measure or value or status.:A period of time of twelve months.:A manner, or usual, or accepted practice of using something.

Concepts.definition: Oral preparations containing dietary ingredient(s) intended to supplement the diet.  Dietary ingredients include vitamins, minerals, herbs, amino acids, extracts and metabolites.
The period of time during which something continues.
A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest is smaller than another object in quantity or measure or value or status.
A period of time of twelve months.
A manner, or usual, or accepted practice of using something.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

ReferenceDocuments.name: If greater than or equal to 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: If greater than or equal to 2,000 IU per day, was the total duration of use less than 12 months?
